body.head: NNA019477

p.note: Jesup North pacific Expedition, Vol. X, p. 192.

body.p: Q!āʼnēqīᵋlax̣ᵘ saw much dirt. He took it and made a house. He finished the house. Then he took water and blew it on the house. Then the house made of dirt became large. It was the house of Only-One. He took cedar-sticks and put them up outside the house, and Q!āʼnēqīᵋlax̣ᵘ took many men and put them inside as posts.The house was named Yūʼibalag·ilîs; the post's name was Bēʼbᴇgumlisila.
